definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: How do almond-flavored liqueurs derive their flavor?
sentences.chinese: 杏味甜酒是怎樣得到這種味道的？

sentences.english: Our Salute Brand Coffee is the most popular beverages offered in the market.
sentences.chinese: 海軍牌咖啡，味道香農可口，最受顧客喜愛。

sentences.english: That mixture is enough to move his jeep; however, whenever the car moves, it exhales food smell.
sentences.chinese: 當車子開動時，總是會散發出食物的味道。
魚餌香氣四溢，味道鮮美。

sentences.english: Seasoning the raw poultry for bourbon mustard chicken will lock in flavor within the meat.
sentences.chinese: 波旁芥末調味的雞生禽將鎖定在肉的味道。

sentences.english: This tea tasted of orange blossoms.
American coffee is usually lightly roasted and often served very weak.
sentences.chinese: 美國咖啡通常經過微焙，味道十分清單。

sentences.english: Which will have started to taste like a sourdough .
sentences.chinese: 這將開始一個拓荒者的味道。

sentences.english: I hear the song of the nightingales, and I smell crushed mulberries.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見夜鶯的歌聲，我聞到壓碎的桑葚味道。

sentences.english: The fish tastes good, Why not have a cup of milk?
sentences.chinese: 這魚味道不錯。爲什麼不來杯牛奶？

sentences.english: Chapter 17 wraps up the book with a list of "code smells" and heuristics.
sentences.chinese: 第十七章將“代碼的味道”和啓示列成一張表。

sentences.english: I ordered the best wine on the menu, regardless of price or taste.
sentences.chinese: 我叫了菜單上最好的甜酒，不管價錢多少，味道好壞。

sentences.english: It tastes like rancid fish steeped in gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 白酒的味道就像泡着腐魚的汽油。

sentences.english: Add sugar and milk to taste.
sentences.chinese: 加入少量的牛奶和糖，味道更佳。

sentences.english: Yellow bell peppers add color and flavor to any recipe.
sentences.chinese: 黃柿子椒添加顏色和味道的任何配方。

definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
